content: I was such an asshole to Rachel, smiling to her face while gossiping behind her back. I cringe when I think about it now, embarrassed by the kind of person I used to be. Even though our friendship didn’t last long I still think about how mean I was to her, even now, nearly two decades later, because I made her feel the way I had felt in high school, tormented for no reason other than the fact that I existed. It’s easy to spread one’s pain like sickness instead of tending to our wounds.
